message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.SD

Reasoning: 
- cs.LG (Machine Learning): The paper discusses a semi-supervised learning approach to discovering new classes in datasets, which falls under the domain of machine learning. 
- cs.CL (Computation and Language): The paper applies the proposed method to language through the CLINC Out-of-scope dataset, which involves natural language processing and falls under the domain of computation and language. 
- cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition): The paper presents results on image datasets such as MNIST, CIFAR-10, and Fashion-MNIST, which are commonly used in computer vision research. 
- cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence): The paper proposes a new heuristic for deciding whether a class is worthy of addition to the training dataset, which involves making decisions based on the learnability of the class. This falls under the domain of artificial intelligence. 
- cs.SD (Sound): Although less likely, it is possible that the proposed method could be applied to sound datasets as well, as the approach is not limited to visual or language data.
